episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including a bizarre historical plan involving Mount Vesuvius, an astonishing spider infestation in Baltimore, the Vatican's surprising music preferences, and the early history of the Olympic Games.

facts.fact: In 1874, there was a plan to transport dead bodies from all over Europe to Mount Vesuvius and throw them in.
In 2010, an abandoned wastewater treatment plant in Baltimore was found to be home to an estimated 107 million spiders with a density of 35,176 spiders per cubic meter.
According to the Vatican, the greatest pop album of all time is Revolver by The Beatles.
For the first 50 years of the Olympics, the only event was the 200-meter sprint.
